result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Hearing held by Zoom video due to the Covid19 pandemic.
10:49 am   Defendant Armando Lara-Nieto appeared in custody by video means.  Attorney Danielle Marie Kranz appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.
Interperter Laura Salcido sworn and appears by video.
Court:  The PD's Ofc. have gone through 48 atty contacts.
Court finds good cause to go beyond the time limits.
CC:  2/25 at 10:45 am    SLH
Lara-Nieto:  I was wondering if I can address bond today.  My daughter has $12,000 she can post and I can hire my own atty..  Kranz:  He's not local.  He has an address in St. Paul, MN.  There was also a search warrant executed in St. Croix Co., Wis..  There was significant amounts of cash....  There was add'l. meth located in that residence.....  He retains Mexican citizenship and he has the clear ability to travel easily.  Cash is appropriate.  Charges carry a significant amout of exposure and the State's case is very strong.
Court:  Ms. Kranz, what's his connection to the St. Croix address?  Kranz:  This was used as a residence and a stash house.....  Court:  Are potential Federal charges coming?  Kranz:  I don't have any info. on that yet.  Lara-Nieto comments further.
COURT:  Given the statements, I think bond was set at a too low level.  I'll deny your bond request.  The bond will remain the same.
OSPD Appt of Counsel report
Civil Case 22CV53 to follow along with this case
SPD still trying to obtain counsel

Def in custody w/Atty Rhodes
Interpreter sworn in
Cash bond req to remain
